breakthroughPP.game

Class GameBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • breakthroughPP.game.GameBoard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Setting

    public class GameBoard
extends java.lang.Object
implements Setting
    This class controls the game and exports a method which takes the players moves.

      • GameBoard

        public GameBoard(int m,
                 int n)
          throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Constructor for the game board with size mxn. Throws an IndexOutOfBoundsException if the size is out of the minimum and maximum range of rows and columns (see private finals).
        Parameters:
        m - Number of rows
        n - Number of columns
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException

                     int color)

        This method takes the moves of the players and evaluates them.
        Parameters:

        color - Color of the player

      • getPossibleMoves

        public Move[] getPossibleMoves(int color)
        This method will give a player all the possible and valid moves he could do at this moment.
        Parameters:
        color - The color of the Player (Setting.RED/BLUE)
        Returns:
        Array of possible and valid moves the player with the color in color can make now.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • getStonePositions

        private Position[] getStonePositions(int color)
        This method returns all Positions on the GameBoard where a Stone with the matching color sit
        Parameters:
        color - The color of the stones which shall be in the Position[]
        Returns:
        Array of all positions where stones with matching color sit
